wikipedia_page.main: Arthur Aspinall, CVO (11 July 1901 – 2 May 1972) was a British historian.

response: The Reverend Arthur "Ashworth" Aspinall (23 June 1846 – 9 June 1929) was a co-founder and the first Principal of The Scots College, Bellevue Hill, Sydney, Australia. He was a Congregational and Presbyterian Minister, and a joint founder of the Historical Society of New South Wales. A portrait of Arthur Aspinall is found in Cameron's Centenary History, p320, Plate 99.

From 1951 until 1954 he was an assistant lecturer at Reading, after being appointed by Arthur Aspinall, the professor of history. Smith was successively lecturer (1954–64), senior lecturer (1964–76) and reader (1976–90) at Reading.
He attended Dame Alice Owen's School in Islington then went on to study at the University of Reading where he also completed his Ph.D. under the supervision of Prof. Arthur Aspinall.
